00013 // Return codes
00014 #define PNGU_OK                                                 0
00015 #define PNGU_ODD_WIDTH                                  1
00016 #define PNGU_ODD_STRIDE                                 2
00017 #define PNGU_INVALID_WIDTH_OR_HEIGHT    3
00018 #define PNGU_FILE_IS_NOT_PNG                    4
00019 #define PNGU_UNSUPPORTED_COLOR_TYPE             5
00020 #define PNGU_NO_FILE_SELECTED                   6
00021 #define PNGU_CANT_OPEN_FILE                             7
00022 #define PNGU_CANT_READ_FILE                             8
00023 #define PNGU_LIB_ERROR                                  9

00029 #define PNGU_COLOR_TYPE_RGB                             4
00030 #define PNGU_COLOR_TYPE_RGB_ALPHA               5
00031 #define PNGU_COLOR_TYPE_UNKNOWN                 6

00038 // Types
00039 typedef unsigned char PNGU_u8;
00040 typedef unsigned short PNGU_u16;
00041 typedef unsigned int PNGU_u32;
00042 typedef unsigned long long PNGU_u64;
00043 
00044 typedef struct
00045 {
00046         PNGU_u8 r;
00047         PNGU_u8 g;
00048         PNGU_u8 b;
00049 } PNGUCOLOR;
00050 
00051 typedef struct
00052 {
00053         PNGU_u32 imgWidth; // In pixels
00054         PNGU_u32 imgHeight; // In pixels
00055         PNGU_u32 imgBitDepth; // In bitx
00056         PNGU_u32 imgColorType; // PNGU_COLOR_TYPE_*
00057         PNGU_u32 validBckgrnd; // Non zero if there is a background color
00058         PNGUCOLOR bckgrnd; // Backgroun color
00059         PNGU_u32 numTrans; // Number of transparent colors
00060         PNGUCOLOR *trans; // Transparent colors
00061 } PNGUPROP;
00062 
00063 // Image context, always initialize with SelectImageFrom* and free with ReleaseImageContext
00064 struct _IMGCTX;
00065 typedef struct _IMGCTX *IMGCTX; 
00066 
00067 
00068 /****************************************************************************
00069 *                                                        Pixel conversion                                                               *
00070 ****************************************************************************/
00071 
00072 // Macro to convert RGB8 values to RGB565
00073 #define PNGU_RGB8_TO_RGB565(r,g,b) ( ((((PNGU_u16) r) & 0xF8U) << 8) | ((((PNGU_u16) g) & 0xFCU) << 3) | (((PNGU_u16) b) >> 3) )
00074 
00075 // Macro to convert RGBA8 values to RGB5A3
00076 #define PNGU_RGB8_TO_RGB5A3(r,g,b,a)    (PNGU_u16) (((a & 0xE0U) == 0xE0U) ? \
00077                                                                                 (0x8000U | ((((PNGU_u16) r) & 0xF8U) << 7) | ((((PNGU_u16) g) & 0xF8U) << 2) | (((PNGU_u16) b) >> 3)) : \
00078                                                                                 (((((PNGU_u16) a) & 0xE0U) << 7) | ((((PNGU_u16) r) & 0xF0U) << 4) | (((PNGU_u16) g) & 0xF0U) | ((((PNGU_u16) b) & 0xF0U) >> 4)))
00079 
00080 // Function to convert two RGB8 values to YCbYCr
00081 PNGU_u32 PNGU_RGB8_TO_YCbYCr (PNGU_u8 r1, PNGU_u8 g1, PNGU_u8 b1, PNGU_u8 r2, PNGU_u8 g2, PNGU_u8 b2);
00082 
00083 // Function to convert an YCbYCr to two RGB8 values.
00084 void PNGU_YCbYCr_TO_RGB8 (PNGU_u32 ycbycr, PNGU_u8 *r1, PNGU_u8 *g1, PNGU_u8 *b1, PNGU_u8 *r2, PNGU_u8 *g2, PNGU_u8 *b2);

00091 // Selects a PNG file, previosly loaded into a buffer, and creates an image context for subsequent procesing.
00092 IMGCTX PNGU_SelectImageFromBuffer (const void *buffer);
00093 
00094 // Selects a PNG file, from any devoptab device, and creates an image context for subsequent procesing.
00095 IMGCTX PNGU_SelectImageFromDevice (const char *filename);
00096 
00097 // Frees resources associated with an image context. Always call this function when you no longer need the IMGCTX.
00098 void PNGU_ReleaseImageContext (IMGCTX ctx);

00109 /****************************************************************************

00112 
00113 // Expands selected image into an YCbYCr buffer. You need to specify context, image dimensions, 
00114 // destination address and stride in pixels (stride = buffer width - image width).
00115 int PNGU_DecodeToYCbYCr (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u32 stride);
00116 
00117 // Macro for decoding an image inside a buffer at given coordinates.
00118 #define PNGU_DECODE_TO_COORDS_YCbYCr(ctx,coordX,coordY,imgWidth,imgHeight,bufferWidth,bufferHeight,buffer)      \
00119                                                                                                                                                                                                                         \
00120                 PNGU_DecodeToYCbYCr (ctx, imgWidth, imgHeight, ((void *) buffer) + (coordY) * (bufferWidth) * 2 +       \
00121                                                         (coordX) * 2, (bufferWidth) - (imgWidth))
00122 
00123 // Expands selected image into a linear RGB565 buffer. You need to specify context, image dimensions, 
00124 // destination address and stride in pixels (stride = buffer width - image width).
00125 int PNGU_DecodeToRGB565 (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u32 stride);
00126 
00127 // Macro for decoding an image inside a buffer at given coordinates.
00128 #define PNGU_DECODE_TO_COORDS_RGB565(ctx,coordX,coordY,imgWidth,imgHeight,bufferWidth,bufferHeight,buffer)      \
00129                                                                                                                                                                                                                         \
00130                 PNGU_DecodeToRGB565 (ctx, imgWidth, imgHeight, ((void *) buffer) + (coordY) * (bufferWidth) * 2 +       \
00131                                                         (coordX) * 2, (bufferWidth) - (imgWidth))
00132 
00133 // Expands selected image into a linear RGBA8 buffer. You need to specify context, image dimensions, 
00134 // destination address, stride in pixels and default alpha value, which is used if the source image 
00135 // doesn't have an alpha channel.
00136 int PNGU_DecodeToRGBA8 (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u32 stride, PNGU_u8 default_alpha);
00137 
00138 // Macro for decoding an image inside a buffer at given coordinates.
00139 #define PNGU_DECODE_TO_COORDS_RGBA8(ctx,coordX,coordY,imgWidth,imgHeight,default_alpha,bufferWidth,bufferHeight,buffer) \
00140                                                                                                                                                                                                                         \
00141                 PNGU_DecodeToRGBA8 (ctx, imgWidth, imgHeight, ((void *) buffer) + (coordY) * (bufferWidth) * 2 +        \
00142                                                         (coordX) * 2, (bufferWidth) - (imgWidth), default_alpha)
00143 
00144 // Expands selected image into a 4x4 tiled RGB565 buffer. You need to specify context, image dimensions
00145 // and destination address.
00146 int PNGU_DecodeTo4x4RGB565 (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer);
00147 
00148 // Expands selected image into a 4x4 tiled RGB5A3 buffer. You need to specify context, image dimensions,
00149 // destination address and default alpha value, which is used if the source image doesn't have an alpha channel.
00150 int PNGU_DecodeTo4x4RGB5A3 (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u8 default_alpha);
00151 
00152 // Expands selected image into a 4x4 tiled RGBA8 buffer. You need to specify context, image dimensions,
00153 // destination address and default alpha value, which is used if the source image doesn't have an alpha channel.
00154 int PNGU_DecodeTo4x4RGBA8 (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u8 default_alpha);
00155 
00156 // Encodes an YCbYCr image in PNG format and stores it in the selected device or memory buffer. You need to 
00157 // specify context, image dimensions, destination address and stride in pixels (stride = buffer width - image width).
00158 int PNGU_EncodeFromYCbYCr (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u32 stride);
00159 
00160 int PNGU_EncodeFromRGB (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u32 stride);
00161 int PNGU_EncodeFromGXTexture (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, void *buffer, PNGU_u32 stride);
00162 int PNGU_EncodeFromEFB (IMGCTX ctx, PNGU_u32 width, PNGU_u32 height, PNGU_u32 stride);

00164 // Macro for encoding an image stored into an YCbYCr buffer at given coordinates.
00165 #define PNGU_ENCODE_TO_COORDS_YCbYCr(ctx,coordX,coordY,imgWidth,imgHeight,bufferWidth,bufferHeight,buffer)      \
00166                                                                                                                                                                                                                         \
00167                 PNGU_EncodeFromYCbYCr (ctx, imgWidth, imgHeight, ((void *) buffer) + (coordY) * (bufferWidth) * 2 +     \
00168                                                         (coordX) * 2, (bufferWidth) - (imgWidth))
